title: Social Skills Groups / Group Therapy
shortDescription: Structured peer groups for practicing social interactions and building friendships.
description: Social skills groups bring together children or teens with autism in structured settings to practice social interactions with peers. Led by trained therapists, these groups teach skills like conversation, reading social cues, perspective-taking, cooperation, and friendship-building. Groups provide a safe space to practice with others who understand social challenges, with immediate feedback and coaching from professionals.
whoCanBenefit: Kids ready for peer interaction practice
Children who benefit from structured social time
